meanings.definition: Not equivalent in value, meaning, or effect.
meanings.sent1: The two paintings were nonequivalent in size.
meanings.sent2: The nonequivalent prices of the two items surprised me.
meanings.sent3: I found it funny how the nonequivalent weights of the fruits made the scale tip unevenly.
meanings.sent4: Her nonequivalent enthusiasm for the project was like a bright light in the room.
meanings.sent5: The nonequivalent colors of the flowers created a beautiful contrast in the garden.

meanings.sent1: The nonequivalent sizes of the shoes made it hard to find a matching pair.
meanings.sent2: The nonequivalent tastes of the dishes made it difficult to choose a favorite.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing how the nonequivalent keys kept getting mixed up in the drawer.
meanings.sent4: The nonequivalent paths they took in life eventually led them to different destinations.
meanings.sent5: The nonequivalent styles of the two artists made their work stand out in the gallery.
